intro: Campylocentrum constanzense, commonly known as the Constantzense starfruit, is a rare and unique species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits that resemble a star when ripe. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a leathery texture with a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
